newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin approves Chernomyrdin trips up to May.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin approves Chernomyrdin trips up to May.

text.p: Russian President Boris Yeltsin has approved the schedule of foreign trips by Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin up to at least May, the chief presidential spokesman said on Tuesday.
Yeltsin's press secretary Sergei Yastrzhembsky told a briefing that during their regular meeting Yeltsin had agreed to Chernomyrdin's trips to China, Slovakia and the Czech Republic.
Asked when the visits would take place, Yastrzhembsky said at least one of them had been scheduled for May.
His remarks suggested the premier would retain his post during a government reshuffle proposed by Yeltsin and expected later this week.
Some Russian media have speculated Chernomyrdin might lose his job during the reshuffle.
